00023 #ifdef USE_QTML
00024 #include "ext_qtstubs.h"
00025 #define patcher_setport(x) (XQT_patcher_setport(x))
00026 #define box_nodraw(x) (XQT_box_nodraw(x))
00027 #define box_enddraw(x) (XQT_box_enddraw(x))
00028 #define SetPort(gp) (XQT_patcher_restoreport(gp))
00029 #define patcher_restoreport(gp) (XQT_patcher_restoreport(gp))

00032 // Macros and Constants
00033 #define RES_ID                  10120           // ID of our SICN resources
00034 #define MAXWIDTH                1024L           // maximum width and height of user object in pixels
00035 #define MAXHEIGHT               512L            //              (defines maximum offscreen canvas allocation)
00036 #define MINWIDTH                20L                     // minimum width and height
00037 #define MINHEIGHT               2L                      //              ...
00038 #define DEFWIDTH                100                     // default width and height
00039 #define DEFHEIGHT               10                      //              ...
00040 #define POLL_INTERVAL   150                     // metro time
00041 
00042 // Data Structure for our object
00043 typedef struct {
00044         t_pxbox         my_box;                         // required box structure for all audio ui externs
00045         void            *obex;                          // max 4.5 object extensions
00046         void            *qelem;                         // queue element to defer drawing commands
00047         void            *clock;                         // clock for polling the audio analysis results
00048         
00049         Rect            rect;                           // for comparing with x_box.b_rect in the update() method
00050         
00051         float           envelope;                       // the result of the amplitude analysis [0.0, 1.0]
00052         float           peak;                           // the loudest sample since the last reset
00053         short           peak_position;
00054         short           peak_level;
00055         
00056         long            attr_defeat;            // turn off the meters
00057 } t_meter;
00058 
00059 // Prototypes for our methods:
00060 void *meter_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);                                  // Object life...
00061 void *meter_menu(void *p, long x, long y, long font);
00062 void meter_free(t_meter *x);
00063 void meter_assist(t_meter *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);  // Max Methods...
00064 void meter_bang(t_meter *x);
00065 void meter_float(t_meter *x, double value);
00066 void meter_int(t_meter *x, long value);
00067 void meter_tick(t_meter *x);
00068 t_int *meter_perform(t_int *w);
00069 void meter_dsp(t_meter *x, t_signal **sp, short *count);
00070 void meter_update(t_meter *x);                                                                                  // UI Methods...
00071 void meter_click(t_meter *x, Point pt, short modifiers);
00072 void meter_psave(t_meter *x, void *w);
00073 void meter_qfn(t_meter *x);                                                                                             // Draw Routines...
00074 void meter_draw(t_meter *x);
00075 t_max_err attr_set_defeat(t_meter *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00076 
00077 // Globals
00078 static t_class *meter_class;
00079 
00080 /************************************************************************************/
00081 // Main() Function
00082 
00083 int main(void)
00084 {       
00085         long attrflags = 0;
00086         t_class *c;
00087         t_object *attr;
00088         
00089         jamoma_init();
00090 
00091         c = class_new("jcom.meter~",(method)meter_new, (method)meter_free, (short)sizeof(t_meter), (method)meter_menu, A_GIMME, 0);
00092         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_meter, obex));
00093 
00094         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_click,         "click", A_CANT, 0L);
00095         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_update,        "update", A_CANT, 0L);
00096         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_psave,         "psave", A_CANT, 0L);   
00097         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_assist,        "assist", A_CANT, 0L); 
00098         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_bang,          "bang", 0L);
00099         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_float,         "float", A_FLOAT, 0L);
00100         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_int,           "int", A_LONG, 0L);
00101         class_addmethod(c, (method)meter_dsp,           "dsp", A_CANT, 0L);             
00102 
00103         attr = attr_offset_new("defeat", _sym_long, attrflags,
00104                 (method)0L,(method)attr_set_defeat, calcoffset(t_meter, attr_defeat));
00105         class_addattr(c, attr);
00106 
00107         class_dspinitbox(c);                                                                    // Setup object's class to work with MSP
00108 
00109         // Finalize our class
00110         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00111         meter_class = c;
00112         return 0;
00113 }

00116 /************************************************************************************/
00117 // Object Life
00118 
00119 // when the UI external is read-in from a patcher file...
00120 void *meter_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00121 {
00122         t_meter *x;
00123         void *patcher;
00124         long x_coord, y_coord, width, height;
00125         //short bw, bh, flags;
00126         short flags;
00127         
00128         x = (t_meter*)object_alloc(meter_class);
00129         if(x){
00130                 dsp_setupbox((t_pxbox *)x, 1);
00131         
00132                 patcher = argv[0].a_w.w_obj;                                    // patcher
00133                 x_coord = argv[1].a_w.w_long;                                   // x coord
00134                 y_coord = argv[2].a_w.w_long;                                   // y coord
00135                 width = argv[3].a_w.w_long;                                             // width
00136                 height = argv[4].a_w.w_long;                                    // height
00137                         
00138                 width = CLIP(width, MINWIDTH, MAXWIDTH);                // constrain to min and max size
00139                 height = CLIP(height, MINHEIGHT, MAXHEIGHT);    // constrain to min and max size
00140                 
00141                 // set flags with which our t_box struct will be initialized:
00142                 //      F_DRAWFIRSTIN - Draw the first inlet
00143                 //      F_NODRAWBOX - don't draw the box
00144                 //      F_GROWBOTH - can grow independently in both width and height
00145                 //      F_DRAWINLAST - draws inlets after box draws
00146                 //      F_SAVVY - tells Max any queue function you make calls box_enddraw()
00147                 flags = F_DRAWFIRSTIN | F_NODRAWBOX | F_GROWBOTH | F_DRAWINLAST | F_SAVVY;
00148         
00149                 // now actually initialize the t_box structure
00150                 box_new((t_box *)x, (t_patcher *)patcher, flags, x_coord, y_coord, x_coord + width, y_coord + height);
00151 
00152                 // Reassign the box's firstin field to point to our new object
00153                 x->my_box.z_box.b_firstin = (void *)x;
00154                 
00155                 // Cache rect for comparisons when the user decides to re-size the object
00156                 x->rect = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect;
00157 
00158                 // Create our queue element for defering calls to the draw function
00159                 x->qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)meter_qfn);
00160 
00161                 // Create clock routine for polling the audio result
00162                 x->clock = clock_new(x, (method)meter_tick);
00163 
00164                 // Set defaults
00165                 x->envelope = 0;
00166                 x->peak = 0;
00167                 
00168                 // Finish it up...
00169                 box_ready((t_box *)x);
00170         }
00171         else
00172                 error("jcom.meter~ - could not create instance");
00173         return(x);
00174 }
00175 
00176 
00177 // if the user selects our object from the toolbar/menu, we supply the _new method with default values
00178 void *meter_menu(void *p, long x, long y, long font)
00179 {
00180         t_atom argv[5];         // reduced to 5 on 24 nov 2004
00181         
00182         SETOBJ(argv, (t_object *)p);                            // patcher
00183         SETLONG(argv+1, x);                                                     // x coord
00184         SETLONG(argv+2, y);                                                     // y coord
00185         SETLONG(argv+3, DEFWIDTH);                                      // width
00186         SETLONG(argv+4, DEFHEIGHT);                                     // height
00187         
00188         return meter_new(gensym("jcom.meter~"), 5, argv);
00189 }

00192 // delete
00193 void meter_free(t_meter *x)
00194 {
00195         dsp_freebox((t_pxbox *)x);                      // a version of dsp_free() for ui objects
00196         qelem_free(x->qelem);                           // delete our qelem
00197         freeobject((t_object *)x->clock);       // delete our clock
00198         box_free((t_box *)x);                           // free the ui box
00199 }

00202 /************************************************************************************/
00203 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00204 
00205 // Method for Assistance Messages
00206 void meter_assist(t_meter *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00207 {
00208         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00209                 strcpy(dst, "Input");
00210         else if(msg==2){                                // Outlets
00211                 switch(arg){
00212                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "Output"); break;
00213                         //case 1: strcpy(dst, "Attribute Stuff"); break;
00214                 }
00215         }               
00216 }

00218 
00219 // Method: bang - clear the peak hold and redraw
00220 void meter_bang(t_meter *x)
00221 {
00222         x->peak = 0;    // reset the peak hold
00223         qelem_set(x->qelem);
00224 }
00225 
00226 
00227 // Method: float - can be used instead of a signal
00228 void meter_float(t_meter *x, double value)
00229 {
00230         x->envelope = value;
00231         qelem_set(x->qelem);
00232 }
00233 
00234 // cast to float...
00235 void meter_int(t_meter *x, long value)
00236 {
00237         meter_float(x, (double)value);
00238 }
00239 
00240 // Attribute: defeat
00241 t_max_err attr_set_defeat(t_meter *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00242 {
00243         x->attr_defeat = atom_getlong(argv);
00244         if(x->attr_defeat == 0) 
00245                 clock_delay(x->clock, POLL_INTERVAL);   // start the clock
00246 
00247         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00248         #pragma unused(attr)
00249 }
00250 
00251 
00252 // Method: triggered by our clock
00253 void meter_tick(t_meter *x)
00254 {
00255         qelem_set(x->qelem);                                                    // draw the meters
00256 
00257         if(sys_getdspstate()) {                                                 // if dsp is on then we schedule another tick
00258                 if(x->attr_defeat == 0)
00259                         clock_delay(x->clock, POLL_INTERVAL);   // schedule the clock
00260         }
00261 }
00262 
00263 
00264 // Method: perform signal processing
00265 t_int *meter_perform(t_int *w)
00266 {
00267         t_meter         *x = (t_meter *)(w[1]);
00268         t_float         *input = (float *)(w[2]);
00269         long            n = (long)(w[3]);
00270         float           currentvalue;
00271 
00272         while(n--){
00273                 currentvalue = ((*input) < 0)?-(*input):*input; // get the current sample's absolute value
00274                 if(currentvalue > x->envelope)                                  // if it's a new peak amplitude...
00275                         x->envelope = currentvalue;
00276                 input++;                                                                                // increment pointer in the vector
00277         }
00278         return (w+4);
00279 }               
00280 
00281 
00282 // Method: compile dsp chain
00283 void meter_dsp(t_meter *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00284 {               
00285         if(count[0]){
00286                 dsp_add(meter_perform, 3, x, sp[0]->s_vec, sp[0]->s_n);
00287                 clock_delay(x->clock, POLL_INTERVAL);                   // start the clock
00288                 x->peak = 0;
00289         }
00290 }

00293 /************************************************************************************/
00294 // Required UI Object Methods
00295 
00296 // Sent when our object needs to be redrawn
00297 //      (this is already at low priority and does not need to be deferred)
00298 void meter_update(t_meter *x)
00299 {
00300         short width_old = x->rect.right - x->rect.left;
00301         short height_old = x->rect.bottom - x->rect.top;
00302         short width_new = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.right - x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.left;
00303         short height_new = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.bottom - x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.top;
00304 
00305         if(height_new != height_old || width_new != width_old) {
00306                 width_new = CLIP(width_new, MINWIDTH, MAXWIDTH); // constrain to min and max size
00307                 height_new = CLIP(height_new, MINHEIGHT, MAXHEIGHT);
00308                 box_size(&x->my_box, width_new, height_new);    // this function actually resizes out t_box structure
00309                 x->rect = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect;
00310                 
00311                 //xgui_allocoffscreen(x); // (existing offsceen is disposed inside)
00312         }
00313 
00314         GrafPtr gp = patcher_setport(x->my_box.z_box.b_patcher);
00315     meter_draw(x);
00316     patcher_restoreport(gp); 
00317 }
00318 
00319 
00320 // If the user clicks on the object
00321 void meter_click(t_meter *x, Point pt, short modifiers)
00322 { 
00323         meter_bang(x);          // reset the peak hold
00324 }
00325 
00326 
00327 // Save our UI object's location and appearance with the patcher...
00328 void meter_psave(t_meter *x, void *w)
00329 {
00330         Rect r = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect;
00331         t_atom argv[16];
00332         short inc = 0;
00333         
00334         SETSYM(argv,gensym("#P"));
00335         if (x->my_box.z_box.b_hidden) { // i.e. if it's hidden when the patcher is locked
00336                 SETSYM(argv+1,gensym("hidden"));
00337                 inc = 1;
00338         }
00339         SETSYM(argv+1+inc, gensym("user"));
00340         SETSYM(argv+2+inc, ob_sym(x));
00341         SETLONG(argv+3+inc, r.left);                    // x
00342         SETLONG(argv+4+inc, r.top);                             // y
00343         SETLONG(argv+5+inc, r.right - r.left);  // width
00344         SETLONG(argv+6+inc, r.bottom - r.top);  // height
00345         
00346         binbuf_insert(w, 0L, 7+inc, argv);
00347 }

00350 /************************************************************************************/
00351 // Drawing Routines
00352 
00353 // The deferred routine called by our Qelem
00354 void meter_qfn(t_meter *x)
00355 {
00356         GrafPtr gp = patcher_setport(x->my_box.z_box.b_patcher);
00357 
00358         if(gp){                         // if the pointer is valid...
00359                 if(!box_nodraw((t_box *)x)){
00360                         meter_draw(x);
00361                         box_enddraw((t_box *) x);
00362                 }
00363         }
00364         SetPort(gp);
00365 }
00366 
00367 
00368 // The actual drawing routine
00369 void meter_draw(t_meter *x)   
00370 { 
00371         GrafPtr         curPort;
00372         GDHandle        curDevice; 
00373         RGBColor        frgb, old_color; 
00374         Rect            rect_ui = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect;
00375         Rect            rect_temp;
00376         short           i; 
00377         short           width_ui = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.right - x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.left;
00378         short           height_ui = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.bottom - x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.top;
00379         short           width_green = 0.96 * width_ui;          // 96% of total width
00380         short           width_red = width_ui - width_green;     // 4% of total width
00381         short           left = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.left;
00382         float           level;
00383         short           position;
00384 
00385         GetGWorld((CGrafPtr *)&curPort, &curDevice);
00386         GetForeColor(&old_color);
00387         PenMode(srcCopy);
00388 
00389         frgb.blue = 0;
00390         frgb.green = 65535;
00391 
00392         rect_temp.top = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.top;
00393         rect_temp.bottom = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.bottom;
00394 
00395         level = CLIP(x->envelope, 0.0, 1.0);            // get the amplitude
00396         
00397         if(level >= 1.0){
00398                 x->peak = 1.0;
00399                 // Draw Green
00400                 for(i=0; i<width_green; i++){
00401                         rect_temp.left = left + i;
00402                         rect_temp.right = rect_temp.left + 1;
00403 
00404                         frgb.red = (i * 65535) / width_green;   
00405                         RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00406                         PaintRect(&rect_temp);
00407                 }
00408 
00409                 rect_temp.left = left + i;
00410                 rect_temp.right = left + width_ui;
00411 
00412                 // Draw Red
00413                 frgb.green = 0;
00414                 RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00415                 PaintRect(&rect_temp);
00416 
00417                 goto out;
00418         }
00419         if(level >= 0.0) {
00420                 level = CLIP(20. * (log10(level)), -96.0, 0.0); // convert to decibels
00421                 level = -(96 - (exp((level) * 0.0344014267) * 96));
00422                 position = (width_green) + (level * 0.0104166667 * width_green);
00423 
00424                 // Draw Green
00425                 for(i=0; i<position; i++){
00426                         frgb.red = (i * 65535) / width_green;   
00427                         RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00428                         MoveTo(left+i, rect_temp.top);
00429                         Line(0, height_ui);
00430                 }
00431                 rect_temp.left = left + i;
00432                 rect_temp.right = left + width_ui;
00433 
00434                 // Draw Gray
00435                 frgb.red = 8000;
00436                 frgb.green = 8000;
00437                 frgb.blue = 8000;
00438                 RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00439                 PaintRect(&rect_temp);
00440         }
00441         else{
00442                 // Draw Gray
00443                 frgb.red = 8000;
00444                 frgb.green = 8000;
00445                 frgb.blue = 8000;
00446                 RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00447                 PaintRect(&rect_ui);
00448         }
00449         
00450         // Peak Hold
00451         if(x->envelope > x->peak){
00452                 x->peak = x->envelope;
00453                 x->peak_position = position;
00454                 x->peak_level = level;
00455         }
00456 
00457         if((x->peak > 0) && (x->peak <1)){      // Green Range
00458                 rect_temp.left = x->peak_position + left;
00459                 rect_temp.right = rect_temp.left + 1;
00460                 frgb.green = 65535;
00461                 frgb.red = x->peak_level * 5653.5;
00462                 RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00463                 PaintRect(&rect_temp);
00464         }
00465         else if(x->peak > 0){                           // Red Range
00466                 rect_temp.left = left + width_green;
00467                 rect_temp.right = x->my_box.z_box.b_rect.right;
00468                 frgb.red = 65535;
00469                 frgb.green = 0;
00470                 frgb.blue = 0;
00471                 RGBForeColor(&frgb);
00472                 PaintRect(&rect_temp);
00473         }
00474         
00475 out:
00476         x->envelope = 0;                                                                // reset the amplitude tracker
00477 
00478         PenNormal();
00479         RGBForeColor(&old_color);       
00480 }
